Welcome to the course website for __STA261__ (Probability & Statistics II). This course is offered by the department of [Statistical Sciences](http://utstat.toronto.edu), and is the second of two canonical mathematical statistics courses designed for undergraduate students in statistical sciences, computer science, and other quantitative fields. 

__Course Requirements__

Undergraduate-level understanding of 

- Prerequisites: STA257H1/ STAB52H3/ STA256H5
- Corequisite: MAT237Y1/ MAT257Y1/ MAT257Y5; MAT223H1/ MAT224H1/ MAT240H1/ MATA22H3/ MATA23H3/ MAT223H5/ MAT240H5/ MATB24H3/ MAT224H5

__Overview__

A rigorous introduction to the theory of statistical inference and to statistical practice. Topics covered include: sampling, statistical models, properties of estimators, likelihood estimation, Bayesian methods, hypothesis testing and confidence interval estimation, and linear regression. Real-world examples will be used to illustrate statistical theory and its limitations.
